name: Premier Inn Glasgow Airport

reviews.text: Overnight stay before flight to Spain was lovely. Staff welcoming and room comfortable and very clean. Price was £49 for me as a solo traveller but seemed good value compared with similiar money paid for less quality elsewhere. Will stay again. Didn't use shuttle bus. Not really far to walk on a pleasant morning.
reviews.title: Premier Inn Glasgow Airport

reviews.text: Rooms very clean and comfy and bathroom very modern.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel to stay during transit

reviews.text: Staff were very friendly, helpfull and provided a good service
reviews.title: Great service at a great price

reviews.text: The shuttle bus is also great, £2 gets you straight to the front door
reviews.title: Great overnight in a good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here the night before my flight to Canada. Pre-booked for £34 which was excellent value for money. The room was modern, clean and very spacious, the bed was sooo comfortable and could find nothing at all to complain about. Normally stay at Holiday Inn Express along the road but Premier Inn so much better quality hotel and cost half the price!! Had most enjoyable buffet breakfast in the restaurant where both food and service were excellent. Within walking distance to the airport although a shuttle bus is available. Would most certainly stay at this Premier Inn again in the future not just the night before a flight and will be highly recommending to others.
reviews.title: Good quality and good price

reviews.text: We booked a room through Premier's site at 8:00AM Saturday morning of a holiday weekend paying in full at the time and receiving a confirmation and a confirming email.. We had a long day of travel ahead of us from Turkey and did not want to drive after our scheduled 10:30pm landing at Glasgow Airport.
reviews.title: Do not count on getting your booked and prepaid room

reviews.text: We took a few minutes to arrange our car. As we were driving the few hundred yards to the hotel, we received a call to see if we were coming. We said we would be there momentarily. On arriving we found they had sold our room and wanted us to stay at a sister hotel they claimed was just a few miles away. Other hotels at the airport were all booked. We had no option!.
reviews.title: Everything WAS Premier except the price!

reviews.text: It turned out their sister hotel was half the way to Prestwick. The roads and roundabouts are confusing and the instructions given us did not include a map. It took us 45 minutes. It was now midnight.
reviews.title: a good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You book a hotel at the airport to be at the airport not 45 minutes away!
reviews.title: great last night stay efore flying back - excellent choice by the airport
A grand hotel at a great price
reviews.text: While they apologized and did not charge us for the alternate accommodation. Including the time to retrace our steps in the morning, we had wasted more than 2 hours. While they claimed to have a computer glitch, it was not until 11:00 pm that they contacted us. They had our email address and phone #. I suspect they deliberately oversold the room thinking we were not arriving.

I had an early flight home so wanted to stay near the airport. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the terminal. My room, and apparently many others, was recently refurbished, and it was quite clean and the bed very comfortable. Wifi access was cheap at 3 pounds for 24 hours. Restaurant was nice for dinner and breakfast. Staff friendly. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Clean and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night to be close to the airport. Check in was fast and friendly also ordered food and was fast, we took to the room everything was fine. Room and bathroom was spotless had a great nights sleep and check out at 12.00 is also great. Only 5 minutes walk to the airport was easy. Had no problems!
reviews.title: Friendly staff and clean rooms

reviews.text: Just a one night business stay. Location is excellent if you need to be close to the airport. Got it at a reasonable price by booking in advance. Thought at first it might be a bit noisy being so close to the airport and underneath the M8 but sound proofing must be good as I never heard a thing. Food in the restaurant was fine and staff were professional. The hotel is currently going through a re-furb. Try a get one of the new rooms, the new flat screen TVs are the largest I have seen in a budget hotel !
reviews.title: No Problems Here

reviews.text: I had such a brillian stay. The staff where so friendly and welcoming. Zoe the receptionist who checked me in made me feel very welcomed and at ease as I was travelling alone, so did the young girl in the restaurant Eilidh. No question or request was too much trouble for them. Also the new rooms are brilliant, amazing 40" TVs, i cant wait to return soon! Thanks for a great stay.
reviews.title: Lovely staff and nice new rooms

reviews.text: Stayed 10-12 February 2012. Room was really clean and comfortable. Ate in the restaurant and was very pleasantly surprised, good value and tasty. Staff very friendly and helpful. Room was quiet and I had a good night's sleep. Good to get 30mins WiFi, just enough to quickly check emails and keep in touch. Would recommend.
reviews.title: very enjoyable stay

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night whilst down visiting family and it was fantastic. Very helpful and friendly staff who went out of their way to make us and our 6yr old daughter welcome. The rooms were immaculate and very comfortable and Breakfast was yummy. We will definately be back for a longer stay and highly reccomend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Will definately be back, highly recommend staying here

reviews.text: Stayed here with my father. We were told to wait when we arrived at about 3.15pm. Quickly realised there were several other parties also waiting to check in. Although there seemed to be other staff around, one obviously new guy was left to struggle trying to check people in. 15 minutes later we finally got to the front of the queue. We requested quiet rooms (normally this is no problem at any other Premier Inn). The chap said he didn't know which rooms were quiet. We ended up with rooms at either side of the hotel. Please give your check-in staff adequate training.
reviews.title: Only complaint was the check in.

reviews.text: Ate at the restaurant. OK food. Service excellent. Same again at breakfast. Same waitress (she may have been manager - from Paisley and very friendly).
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms spotless.
reviews.title: Premier Inn Glasgow Airport

reviews.text: Handy BP petrol station and shop next door.
reviews.title: Airport Hotel

description: Situated within the grounds of Glasgow Airport, this Premier Inn is an ideal location for both business and leisure. We provide shuttle bus and park and fly offers. An ideal location for visiting Braehead, Paisley, Glasgow or simply flying out on holiday. All our rooms are en suite, with colour TV. All of our rooms are backed by our "Good Night Guarantee" we guarantee you a good nights sleep or your money back!
